## vision\_v1.Schema$AnnotateFileRequest interface

A request to annotate one single file, e.g. a PDF, TIFF or GIF file.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface Schema$AnnotateFileRequest 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [features](./vision.vision_v1.schema_annotatefilerequest.features.md) | [Schema$Feature](./vision.vision_v1.schema_feature.md)<!-- -->\[\] | Required. Requested features. |
|  [imageContext](./vision.vision_v1.schema_annotatefilerequest.imagecontext.md) | [Schema$ImageContext](./vision.vision_v1.schema_imagecontext.md) | Additional context that may accompany the image(s) in the file. |
|  [inputConfig](./vision.vision_v1.schema_annotatefilerequest.inputconfig.md) | [Schema$InputConfig](./vision.vision_v1.schema_inputconfig.md) | Required. Information about the input file. |
|  [pages](./vision.vision_v1.schema_annotatefilerequest.pages.md) | number\[\] \| null | Pages of the file to perform image annotation.<!-- -->Pages starts from 1, we assume the first page of the file is page 1. At most 5 pages are supported per request. Pages can be negative.<!-- -->Page 1 means the first page. Page 2 means the second page. Page -1 means the last page. Page -2 means the second to the last page.<!-- -->If the file is GIF instead of PDF or TIFF, page refers to GIF frames.<!-- -->If this field is empty, by default the service performs image annotation for the first 5 pages of the file. |
